comments:

console:

ImportWizard agentProxy=org.eclipse.hyades.models.hierarchy.impl.TRCAgentProxyIm
pl@11a47df (name: Apache HTTP Server access log /home/smith/logs/test.longrecord
.access.log, type: Logging, runtimeId: null, startTime: 0.0, stopTime: 1.1316909
56265E12, collectionMode: HEAP_STATISTICS_ONLY, active: false, attached: false,
collectionData: false, monitored: false, profileFile: null, deltaTime: 0.0)/0

I was using the TPTP 4.1 200511090100 driver and Sun JDK 1.4.2_08 to run 
eclipse.  I was remote importing from a Linux PPC64 machine to my Windows 2000 
client machine.

Created an attachment (id=29753)
Apache access log that generates a serialized CBE of length 70K

When I import this log remotely when Agent Controller is configured with
isDataMultiplexed="true", no records are shown in the log view.  The third
record is the long one.

Note, when using an IBM JDK 1.4.2, the exception shown in the eclipse console 
is different.  It is InvalidXMLException.

I did some debugging of this problem and found the code in 
MultiplexedDataServer.processData() is not processing data larger than 8K 
correctly.
Target this to 4.1 i3 but not sure it can be contained.

This seems way out there for this stage of the release -- but is it possible to
use the file system services (file transfer) for transmitting files from the
server to the client (perhaps in the future at least).  

There are no size limitations and the file system services server can be run
outside the scope of an agent controller (using an ephemeral local port or a
pre-assigned port for accepting connections on).  This service has matured in
the last few releases since it was first released -- it has a bunch of nifty
features and is fast (easy to write new file system services as well).

Deferring this to 4.2 as the problem existed in 4.0 and is likely hidden by the 
problem reported in bugzilla 113831.  This deferral was approved by Harm 
Sluiman of the PMC.
A readme item was added for this in 4.1 Release notes - see https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=118712.
Will take a look in i3.
Set to P2 per Platform call.

The processData() incorrectly returns after resizing the buffer. Therefore the message is lost. The fix is trivial by removing the "return" statment after the resize.

Fix checked in 2006/05/12 23:34 EDT.
